Key Match Events: Kerry Carpenter hit a three-run homer in the ninth inning off All-Star closer Emmanuel Clase for a 3-0 victory against the AL Central champions.
Detroit used seven pitchers to eliminate AL West champion Houston to finish a two-game wild card sweep for its first postseason series win since 2013.
Pre-Game Insights: Tigers manager A.J. Hinch plans to use many pitchers for an inning or so Wednesday as he has twice in the playoffs and in a slew of games in the regular season.
Hinch did not announce who will start for Detroit, but said he intended to inform the Guardians by the end of their workout Tuesday.

The Guardians have a player making a long-awaited return to the postseason. Alex Cobb last appeared in the playoffs in 2013 when he started two games for Tampa Bay, a wild-card win against Cleveland and a Division Series loss to Boston.
Post-Match Reflections: Tigers president of baseball operations Scott Harris expressed excitement about the return of playoff baseball to Detroit and the impact of the fans.
Alex Cobb reflected on his long journey back to the postseason and expressed confidence in his team's defense and bullpen.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Motor City has not hosted a playoff baseball game in a decade.
Detroit tied the series Monday with a 3-0 victory against the AL Central champions.
